text: Michael Edward Love (born March 15, 1941) is an American singer-songwriter. He co-founded the Beach Boys. Love was one of Brian Wilson's collaborators during the Beach Boys' peak in the 1960s. The best known Wilsonâ€“Love songs were "Fun, Fun, Fun" (1964), "California Girls" (1965), and "Good Vibrations" (1966). ==References== Category:1941 births Category:Living people Category:American rock singers Category:American pop singers Category:Singer-songwriters from California Category:Singers from Los Angeles Category:Writers from Los Angeles
title: Mike Love
